instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.R7402: What is R7402? Resistor between PPVIN_S0_CPUIMVP and CPUIMVP_TON. TON stands for TIME ON – CPUIMVP_TON configures the buck converter for the CPU based on its input power supply. If this resistor is blown, the machine will turn on but not have any image, chime, or POST, because CPU vcore will be missing. This resistor is often the first to corrode because it is along a high voltage rail and it is right on the edge of the board, check this on 2011-2012 model Macbook Pros that turn on and do not chime. .
definitions.C7050: What is C7050? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for battery current sensing, you should measure around 2.202 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.BKL_PWM: What is BKL_PWM? BKL_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKL_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..
definitions.BKL_EN: What is BKL_EN? BKL_EN enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKL” before “_EN”. “BKL” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. .
definitions.LP8550: What is LP8550? This is an LED driver responsible for creating the backlight on the LCD screen of Macbooks from 2011 through 2015.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B - Turn ON and OFF
threads.message:
Green Light - OK
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - OK
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> - OK
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> - OK
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> - 2.20v and drop for 0v (turn on and off fan)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B - Turn ON and OFF
threads.message: Checked! Looks fine

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B - Turn ON and OFF
threads.message:
Looks fine? Measure it!
If <RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR> is ok then measure voltage on Y2805 should not exceed 1.6V else clock chip is dead. 
I assume this was a liquid damage?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B - Turn ON and OFF
threads.message: A mean: I measure and is fine! Yes, liquid damage.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B - Turn ON and OFF
threads.message: if resistance over <CAPACITOR>C7050</CAPACITOR> doesn't exceed 2.2 to 4 ohms then <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> is probably dead. so check duke's advice because that is the best way to tell if <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> is dead. i am also going to guess your liquid damage was on the rim, by either vp0r sensor, thunderbolt area, or smc. even if the clock chip has no corrosion or water on it, just water in that area, it means it is dead..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B - Turn ON and OFF
threads.message: [USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER] [USER="1"]larossmann[/USER] I replaced <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> and works (fan spin), but i don't backlight.
